channel.title: api on Budibase | Build internal tools on your own infrastructure
channel.description: Recent content in api on Budibase | Build internal tools on your own infrastructure
channel.copyright: This work is licensed and owned by Budibase

item.title: Budibase Webhooks | Use webhooks to enrich your Budibase applications
item.description: Use webhooks to connect your application to other applications. With webhooks, you can pull data into Budibase, and push data out.

item.title: Build apps from start to finish with Budibase
item.description: Budibase has its own database which you can use to support your application. This allows you to build applications from start to finish, all within Budibase.

item.title: CouchDB integration with Budibase | Data source for building business apps
item.description: Budibase integrates with Apache CouchDB allowing you to use CouchDB as your data source for your applications. CouchDB is an open-source document-oriented NoSQL database, implemented in Erlang.

item.title: CSV integration with Budibase | Data source for building business apps
item.description: A Comma-separated values file is a delimited text file that uses a comma to separate values. Easily upload data to Budibase using CSVs. When you upload your CSV, Budibase will recognise the column/field names. You then have the ability to change the data type of the column, and remove if you like, before uploading to Budibase.

item.title: DynamoDB integration with Budibase | Data source for building business apps
item.description: Budibase integrates with DynamoDB allowing you to use DynamoDB as your data source for your applications. DynamoDB is a fully managed proprietary NoSQL database service by Amazon.

item.title: Elasticsearch integration with Budibase | Data source for building business apps
item.description: Use Elasticsearch as your data source for your Budibase applications. Elasticsearch is a fully distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine based on the Lucene library.

item.title: Integromat integration with Budibase | Connect your app to the world
item.description: Integrate with a number of external APIs using the Budibase Integromat integration. Integromat is a tool that helps you automate manual processes, without coding.

item.title: MongoDB integration with Budibase | Use MongoDB as your data source
item.description: Use MongoDB as your data source for your Budibase applications. MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program.

item.title: MySQL integration with Budibase | Data source for building business apps
item.description: Budibase integrates with MySQL allowing you to use MySQL as your data source for your applications. MySQL Database Service is a fully managed database service to deploy cloud-native applications.

item.title: PostgreSQL integration with Budibase | Use PostgreSQL as your data source
item.description: Use PostgreSQL as your data source for your Budibase applications. PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management.

item.title: S3 integration with Budibase | Use S3 as your data source
item.description: Use Amazon S3 as your data and object source for your Budibase applications. Amazon S3 provides object storage through a web service interface which is accessible at any time.

item.title: Airtable integration with Budibase | Data source for building web apps
item.description: Budibase integrates with Airtable allowing you to use Airtable as your data source for your applications. Airtable is a cloud collaboration service headquartered in San Francisco. It was founded in 2012 by Howie Liu, Andrew Ofstad, and Emmett Nicholas. Airtable is a spreadsheet-database hybrid, with the features of a database but applied to a spreadsheet.

item.title: ArangoDB integration with Budibase | Data source for building internal tools
item.description: Budibase integrates with ArangoDB allowing you to use ArangoDB as your data source for your applications. ArangoDB is a free and open-source native multi-model database system developed by ArangoDB GmbH. The database system supports three data models with one database core and a unified query language AQL. The query language is declarative and allows the combination of different data access patterns in a single query.

item.title: DigitalOcean integration with Budibase | Self-host your Budibase apps with Digital Ocean
item.description: You can self-host your Budibase applications using DigitalOcean. DigitalOcean provides developers cloud services that help to deploy and scale applications that run simultaneously on multiple computers.

item.title: Docker integration with Budibase | Self-host your Budibase apps with Docker
item.description: You can self-host your Budibase applications using Docker Compose. Docker is a set of platform as a service products that use OS-level virtualization to deliver software in packages called containers. Containers are isolated from one another and bundle their own software, libraries and configuration files; they can communicate with each other through well-defined channels.
